title: Olympic National Park: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons               Operating Hours & Seasons        Hurricane Ridge Visitor Center overlooks mountain valleys in Olympic National Park. NPS Photo       Olympic National Park is Open Olympic National Park is open 24 hours a day, year-round. The most popular months to visit are June through September. During the busy summer season, most roads and facilities are open and a full range of programs are available to enjoy. From October through May, some roads, campgrounds, and other visitor facilities are closed or have reduced hours. Visitor centers and Hurricane Ridge Road are closed Thanksgiving and Christmas. Other roads and facilities remain open, weather permitting.  See opening and closing dates for more information. All roads and facilities are subject to temporary closures due to weather and construction. Check current conditions for roads, campgrounds, and weather before your visit. For updated information about closures, please call the Olympic National Park Visitor Center at 360-565-3130 or the park's hotline at 360-565-3131.  The park's newspaper, The Bugler, includes a current schedule of ranger-led programs and information about seasonal recreation opportunities.        Opening and Closing Dates           Visitor Centers and Ranger Stations            Roads            Campgrounds             Lodges and Concessions
